posts.post_content:
Hmm... At first, my thoughts were "I like [Garruk's Companion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Companion) better", but then I clued in that this could be easier to play than [Watchwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Watchwolf), a card I thought was better than the Companion.  
  
It's kind of weird when commenters put things into perspective.

Posted By: blurrymadness (7/10/2013 10:03:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I like the fact that this is non-castable off a [Burning-Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning-Tree Emissary) at two mana. When [Flinthoof Boar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flinthoof Boar) was legal, Emissary-into-Boar strategy was so dominant that most aggro decks want it (though [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence) changed it a bit). With this thing at GG, [Ash Zealot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ash Zealot) at RR, Voice and [Call of the Conclave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call of the Conclave) at GW and [Spike Jester](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spike Jester) at BR, aggro strategies should become more diversified than simply a search for the next top-tier creature that passes the Burning-Tree test.
posts.html:
I like the fact that this is non-castable off a Burning-Tree Emissary at two mana. When Flinthoof Boar was legal, Emissary-into-Boar strategy was so dominant that most aggro decks want it (though Voice of Resurgence changed it a bit). With this thing at GG, Ash Zealot at RR, Voice and Call of the Conclave at GW and Spike Jester at BR, aggro strategies should become more diversified than simply a search for the next top-tier creature that passes the Burning-Tree test.

posts.post_content:
I find it odd that I have opened like 10 packs of 2014 and I got three of this guy, but not a single [Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic).   
On the other hand I did get a certain archangel, paladin, and a foil reaver, so I am certainly not complaining.  
(And seeing how every other color now has a "bears" for two mana, usually with wild abilities stapled on, I think this card is just fine for green. Maybe even could have gotten GGG: Regenerate, which would have made it more solidly uncommon.)
posts.html:
